intro: Psoralea mexicana var. trianae, commonly known as the Mexican psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, bean-like pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
